definition: to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: Our army is attacking the enemy, and hopefully will defeat them by late afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 軍發起進擊，有望在傍晚將其擊退。

sentences.english: The soldiers advanced on the enemy.
He led an assault on the enemy's fortress.
sentences.chinese: 他領導了對敵人要塞的進擊。

sentences.english: Adversity always exists, while life is to advance.
sentences.chinese: 逆境總是有的，人生就是進擊。

sentences.english: Did you read the mhadriing in regards to the terrorist panic attair coolingk?
sentences.chinese: 你看那篇關於恐懼進擊的文章了嗎？

sentences.english: The soldiers advanced towards the enemy.
Our army advanced against the enemy.

definition: imaginative/to have one's mind buzzing with ideas
(old) commanding general/commander-in-chief/(Qing dynasty) title for a governor-general (provincial military governor) 總督|总督[zong3 du1]
barrage (military)/"bullet screen", function which allows viewers to post on-screen comments in videos, movies etc in real time/danmaku (video game subgenre)
to cheat in an online game (abbr. for 開外掛|开外挂[kai1 wai4 gua4])/(coll.) unbelievably good
lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
